definitions: having a quality that stays in the mind and evokes strong emotions or memories
relating to or suggesting the presence of ghosts or otherworldly spirits
examples: The movie's haunting melody stayed with me for weeks
She had a haunting beauty that photographers loved
The haunting presence in the old mansion scared visitors
They heard haunting sounds coming from the empty room

definitions: functioning erratically or not working properly in an unpredictable way
examples: The computer system went haywire after the update
His plans went completely haywire when it started raining

definitions: involving or exposing one to risk of harm, injury, or danger
examples: The factory workers handled hazardous chemicals with protective gear
Driving in fog can be hazardous to your safety

definitions: of a light brown or yellowish-brown color, especially describing eyes
examples: Her beautiful hazel eyes changed color in different light
He wore a hazel jacket that matched his shoes

definitions: covered by a slight mist or fog that reduces clarity
lacking definite form, clarity, or precision in thought or memory
examples: The hazy morning mist covered the mountain valley
We could see hazy outlines of ships in the distance
My memories of childhood are quite hazy after so long
She gave only hazy details about the incident

definitions: going or traveling towards a particular place or destination
having a particular type or number of heads as specified
examples: The train headed north will arrive at platform three
We're headed to the beach for summer vacation
The double-headed eagle is a famous heraldic symbol
She used headed notepaper for official correspondence

definitions: lacking a head through removal, absence, or by design
examples: The headless statue stood mysteriously in the garden
They discovered a headless mannequin in the storage room

definitions: moving with the head leading in a rush or fall
done quickly without careful thought or consideration of consequences
examples: He fell headlong down the stairs in his hurry
The child dove headlong into the swimming pool
They rushed headlong into marriage without thinking it through
The company made a headlong decision to expand overseas

definitions: determined to have one's own way regardless of advice or reason
examples: The headstrong teenager refused to listen to her parents
His headstrong nature often got him into trouble

definitions: having a strong effect on your senses or emotions in an exciting way
tending to make one dizzy or affecting mental clarity
examples: The heady perfume filled the entire room with fragrance
Success brought a heady feeling of accomplishment
The heady wine made everyone feel lightheaded quickly
They enjoyed the heady atmosphere of the jazz club

definitions: having recovered from injury, illness, or emotional damage
examples: His healed wounds left only faint scars behind
The healed relationship between them grew stronger than before

definitions: having the ability to restore health or wholeness to body or mind
examples: The healing properties of herbs have been known for centuries
She found the mountain retreat had a healing atmosphere

definitions: conducive to or promoting physical or mental health and well-being
examples: They chose healthful snacks instead of processed foods
Regular exercise is a healthful habit everyone should develop

definitions: in better health or more conducive to good health than something else
examples: She feels much healthier after changing her diet
Fresh vegetables are healthier than canned ones

definitions: perceived or experienced through the sense of hearing
examples: The heard testimony convinced the jury of his innocence
Their heard complaints led to changes in company policy

definitions: based on what others have said rather than direct knowledge or evidence
examples: The judge dismissed the hearsay evidence from the trial
Don't believe hearsay stories without checking the facts

definitions: causing overwhelming sadness, grief, or disappointment that affects one deeply
examples: The heartbreaking news of the accident shocked the community
It was heartbreaking to see the abandoned puppies

definitions: suffering from overwhelming sadness, especially from loss or disappointment
examples: She was heartbroken when her best friend moved away
The heartbroken widow couldn't stop crying at the funeral

definitions: expressing genuine feeling or sincere emotion from the heart
examples: He gave a heartfelt apology for his mistakes
The heartfelt tribute brought tears to everyone's eyes

definitions: showing no sympathy, kindness, or feeling for others
examples: The heartless landlord evicted the family in winter
It was heartless to ignore the homeless man's plea

definitions: causing feelings of happiness, pleasure, and emotional warmth
examples: The heartwarming reunion of the lost dog with its owner went viral
She told a heartwarming story about helping strangers

definitions: showing warm and unreserved friendliness or enthusiasm
providing abundant nourishment or being satisfyingly large
examples: He gave us a hearty welcome when we arrived
The team received hearty congratulations for their victory
They served a hearty breakfast to start the day
The hearty soup warmed us on the cold night

definitions: raised to a high temperature or made warm
marked by strong feelings, anger, or passionate disagreement
examples: The heated pool was perfect for winter swimming
She served heated towels to the spa guests
They had a heated argument about politics last night
The heated debate continued for hours without resolution

definitions: lacking culture, moral principles, or religious beliefs according to a particular viewpoint
examples: The missionaries considered the remote tribe's customs heathen
His heathen behavior shocked the conservative community

definitions: relating to heaven or the divine realm in religious contexts
giving great pleasure or being wonderfully enjoyable
examples: The choir sang heavenly hymns during the service
Ancient texts describe heavenly beings visiting earth
The chocolate cake tasted absolutely heavenly
They spent a heavenly week at the beach resort

definitions: full of frantic activity, confusion, or excitement
examples: Monday mornings at the office are always hectic
She had a hectic schedule with back-to-back meetings

definitions: devoted to the pursuit of pleasure and self-gratification as a way of life
examples: His hedonistic lifestyle included expensive cars and parties
The resort catered to hedonistic tourists seeking luxury

definitions: having considerable weight or bulk that requires effort to move
impressively large in size, amount, or extent
examples: The movers struggled with the hefty sofa up the stairs
He carried a hefty backpack on the hiking trip
They paid a hefty price for the waterfront property
The company faced hefty fines for environmental violations

definitions: making or becoming more intense, aware, or prominent
examples: The heightening tension in the room made everyone nervous
Music played a heightening role in the film's drama

definitions: shockingly evil or wicked deserving strong condemnation
examples: The heinous crime shocked the entire nation
Such heinous acts of violence cannot be tolerated

definitions: kept in position by grasping or supporting with hands or arms
arranged, conducted, or taking place as an event
examples: The held package couldn't be delivered without signature
She kept the held position for several minutes
The held conference attracted thousands of participants
All held meetings must be recorded for compliance

definitions: having the shape or form of a helix or spiral
examples: DNA has a famous helical structure of double strands
The helical staircase wound elegantly through the tower

definitions: having or representing the sun as the center, especially of the solar system
examples: Copernicus proposed the heliocentric model of our solar system
The heliocentric theory revolutionized astronomical understanding

definitions: resembling or suggesting hell in being extremely unpleasant, difficult, or painful
examples: The hellish traffic made the commute take three hours
They endured hellish conditions during the mountain storm

definitions: having the head protected or covered with a helmet
examples: The helmeted motorcyclist rode safely through heavy traffic
All helmeted players took the field for practice

definitions: lacking the ability to act or help oneself without assistance
examples: The baby birds were helpless without their mother
She felt helpless watching the flood destroy homes

definitions: of or relating to half of a sphere, especially half of the earth
examples: Climate patterns show distinct hemispheric differences north and south
The conference addressed hemispheric cooperation between nations

definitions: having the shape or form of half a sphere
examples: The hemispherical dome covered the stadium perfectly
They installed hemispherical security cameras for better coverage

definitions: publicly announced, proclaimed, or praised as significant
examples: The heralded discovery changed our understanding of physics
Critics heralded the film as the year's best

definitions: of or relating to the system of coats of arms and heraldic symbols
examples: The castle displayed various heraldic shields on its walls
She studied heraldic traditions of medieval European families

definitions: denoting plants with soft, green stems rather than woody ones that die down annually
examples: The garden featured many herbaceous perennials that bloom each spring
Herbaceous borders require regular maintenance and division

definitions: relating to or made from plants used for medicine, flavoring, or scent
examples: She preferred herbal tea to regular coffee
The store specialized in herbal remedies and supplements

definitions: feeding only on plants rather than meat
examples: Cows are herbivorous animals that graze on grass
The herbivorous dinosaurs had special teeth for grinding plants

definitions: transmitted from parent to offspring through genes
passed down by legal right from one generation to another
examples: Some diseases are hereditary and run in families
They discovered hereditary traits in the plant species
The hereditary title passed to the eldest son
Many monarchies have hereditary systems of succession

definitions: holding opinions contrary to accepted doctrine, especially religious doctrine
examples: His heretical views got him expelled from the church
The scientist's heretical theory challenged conventional wisdom

definitions: able to be inherited or passed from parent to offspring
examples: Intelligence appears to have some heritable components
The estate included various heritable assets and properties

definitions: having both male and female reproductive organs or characteristics
examples: Some hermaphrodite plants can self-pollinate without other plants
The hermaphrodite earthworm has reproductive organs of both sexes

definitions: sealed completely to prevent air or gas from entering or escaping
relating to ancient mystical or alchemical writings difficult to understand
examples: The hermetic seal kept the food fresh for months
They stored chemicals in hermetic containers for safety
He studied hermetic texts about ancient spiritual practices
The hermetic philosophy influenced many Renaissance thinkers

definitions: showing extreme courage, determination, or ability admired by others
examples: The firefighter's heroic actions saved three children
She made a heroic effort to finish the marathon

definitions: showing reluctance or indecision before acting or speaking
examples: She was hesitant to accept the job offer immediately
His hesitant manner suggested he was hiding something
